book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Play a poor contract in the best possible way
key_insight: Run the jack of spades on the second trick. If the queen is onside, play the ace of diamonds next (a safety play against a single king of diamonds). If the spade finesse fails, you may still find the king of diamonds doubleton onside.
solution_summary: Run the jack of spades on the second trick. If the queen is onside, play the ace of diamonds next (a safety play against a single king of diamonds). If the spade finesse fails, you may still find the king of diamonds doubleton onside.
alternate_result: Closed room - Contract 6♠ +920 for EW. You played accurately: no swing. You failed to make the slam: -14 IMP.
educational_value: Demonstrates playing poor contracts optimally by combining chances
related_concepts: Combining chances, safety play, poor contract management

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Try to combine all your chances
key_insight: 3-5. Cash the ace and king of hearts and ruff a heart. If hearts break 3-3 you can play the dummy reversal. If instead heart break 4-2, then the spades must be 3-3.
solution_summary: Order of play: 3-5. Cash the ace and king of hearts and ruff a heart. If hearts break 3-3 you can play the dummy reversal. If instead heart break 4-2, then the spades must be 3-3.
alternate_result: Closed room: 3NT +430 for EW. Establishing the hearts (finding them 3-3) and a dummy reversal: +10 IMP. Some other line: -10 IMP.
educational_value: Shows combining multiple suit break possibilities
related_concepts: Combining chances, dummy reversal, suit break analysis

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Play one suit to leave you the best remaining chance in another suit
key_insight: 1-2. Ace of heart and a diamond to the ace. 3-4. A club to dummy and a diamond to the queen. The unfavourable diamond break will not prevent you from making the contract. 5-6. A spade to the ace and finesse the jack of spades of spades. This way you manage to collect 12 tricks.
solution_summary: Order of play: 1-2. Ace of heart and a diamond to the ace. 3-4. A club to dummy and a diamond to the queen. The unfavourable diamond break will not prevent you from making the contract. 5-6. A spade to the ace and finesse the jack of spades of spades. This way you manage to collect 12 tricks.
alternate_result: Closed room - Contract 6♦, +1370 for EW. You made 6NT: +2 IMP. You took another line of play: -16 IMP.
educational_value: Demonstrates playing one suit to preserve chances in another
related_concepts: Suit management, preserving chances, entry timing

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: You do not know which way to finesse ♥10
key_insight: Win the spade lead with the king, play four rounds of diamonds and then exit with ace and another spade. After cashing one more spade trick, the defenders will have to play hearts or clubs, giving you a seventh trick.
solution_summary: Win the spade lead with the king, play four rounds of diamonds and then exit with ace and another spade. After cashing one more spade trick, the defenders will have to play hearts or clubs, giving you a seventh trick.
alternate_result: Closed room - You team-mates, playing NS, went down in 2♠. Result: +50 for EW. You played correctly in 1NT: +1 IMP. You tried to find ♥10: -3 IMP.
educational_value: Shows how to handle two-way finesses through endplay

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Make the dangerous opponent pay a high price for gaining the lead
key_insight: 2-3. Play the ace and king of clubs. 4. If club break 3-2, overtake the jack with the queen and play a heart. a) if South raises with the ace, you have three heart tricks (the ♠5 will let you enter the dummy), b) if you win the heart trick, switch to the diamonds.
solution_summary: Order of play: 2-3. Play the ace and king of clubs. 4. If club break 3-2, overtake the jack with the queen and play a heart. a) if South raises with the ace, you have three heart tricks (the ♠5 will let you enter the dummy), b) if you win the heart trick, switch to the diamonds.
alternate_result: Closed room - Contract 3NT +400 for EW. Good play: - no swing. Wrong play: -10 IMP. Faultless declarer play will earn you +47 IMP = 24-6 VP.
educational_value: Shows making dangerous opponents pay for gaining the lead
related_concepts: Dangerous opponent, entry management, suit establishment
